column2: Connectivity error Signal was unable to connect to the server

column2: Allow disable ringtone per conversation
column3: Currently it is possible to choose a different ringtone per conversation However it does not seem to be possible to have no ringtone for a specific conversation while having some ringtone the system one in my case for all the others The per conversation ringtone selection lacks the None option

column2: Allow notification messages in muted groups
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Feature description It is currently not possible to still receive notification messages for a group when you have enabled the Mute notifications option in a group chat In other words both the notification sound and the notification messages are muted WhatsApp gives you the option to still receive notifications for a group chat after you muted it thus effectively only muting the notification sound I received a complaint from a user who just converted from WhatsApp to Signal who would like this feature to also be present in Signal Steps to reproduce open a group chat click on the options menu Mute notifications Wanted result ideally there would be a check box allowing you to choose if you still want to receive notification messages Screenshots This shows how WhatsApp implemented this feature screenshot 20161027 183245 Device info Device Nexus 5 Android version 6 0 1 Signal version 3 20 4

column2: Wishlist Video calls

column2: Messages shuffle on scroll

column2: identical message displayed multiple times
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description When sending a Signal message not SMS from a heavily overloaded WIFI network the client attempts to send the message multiple times expected and eventually displays a red Not delivered Tap for details Apparently the message went through nonetheless and not just once but multiple times and is displayed at all recipients multiple times group chat We observed this problem within multiple group chats and was triggered by distinct senders I personally observed it in two distinct group chats friends also confirmed this in other group chats Note the sender did not press any of the RESEND buttons Steps to reproduce reproducing the exact network failure rates environment is not really possible but here are the simple steps sender try to send a message while the 3 dots show that the client attempts to still send recipient displays the same message by the same sender multiple times Actual result Message is displayed multiple time between 6 and 15 times in our cases Expected result The recipient detects that this is the identical message via a message id replay protection Device info Sender is Signal version 3 25 3 and others Recipient is Signal version 3 25 3 and others

column2: Notification message shown repeatedly for specific contact

column2: Choose preferred SIM
column3: Signal seems to send unsecured SMS on dual SIM phones using the first SIM present in the device irrespective of the user is preferred SIM Android system setting A choice of SIM to send from would be great When a conversation is opened I suggest having Signal tell the user that it will send SMS from the SIM that the most recent message in the conversation was sent or received on If no messages yet exist in the conversation I would instead use the preferred SIM for SMS in Android is settings If Android is preferred SMS SIM has been set to ask every time then I would simply choose one arbitrarily You could instead prompt the user but that seems unnecessarily obtrusive to me Finally it would also be nice to be able to at any moment toggle between SIMs or cycle between them in the case of a 4 SIM phone using some mechanism like swiping left or right on the compose message box Other apps will actually pop up a SIM selector dialog but I find this to be annoyingly obtrusive Thanks for considering this feature

column2: Do not call Notification setSound with empty ringtone
column3: Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Android 5 1 1 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description This PR fixes improves 5462 and makes the behavior consistent between Signal default notification preferences and per recipient preferences Info on recipient ringtone preferences see 4957 ringtone null means Signal default ringtone toString isEmpty means silent If you set a recipient is ringtone to silent Android will not play a notification sound because the value is an empty URI But whenever Notification setSound was called and the device is muted Android will vibrate on notifications instead even in case of an empty URI I tested this on Android 5 1 1 so it is possible that other versions of Android do not vibrate in that case How to test steps to reproduce Android 5 1 1 1 set device muted vibrate only 2 set Signal notification preferences to Sound none Vibrate disabled 2a set Recipient notification settings to default 3a receive message notification does not vibrate 3 set Recipient notification settings to Sound silent Vibrate disabled 1a set Signal notification settings to Sound default Vibrate on 2a receive message notification does vibrate So Signal should not call setSound in either case if the URI is empty

column2: Change MMS Size Limit based on Carrier Restrictions
column3: x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor License Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Pixel XL Android 7 1 1 Nexus 6 Android 7 0 Virtual device Nexus 5x Android 7 1 1 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description This adjusts the MMS Max Size for the 4 major US carriers based on APN MMSC URL properties The design tenet of no new preferences required an automatic fix but that fix requires assumption of new data aka keeping and referencing known carrier URLs These URLs used for matching are housed in strings xml to be easily maintained in the future When creating a new MMS the size constraints query the existing APN database information and matches to a URL and either passes a new size factor or continues with the default

column2: Fix occasional crash on Android 7 direct reply
column3: Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Nexus 4 Android 7 1 Galaxy S5 LineageOS Android 7 1 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description Describe briefly what your pull request proposes to fix Especially if you have more than one commit it is helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works The use of the RecipientFactory in the RemoteReplyReceiver was done in the main thread This is a problem when the recipient is data is not cached because then the ContactPhotoFactory would perform Glide actions on the main thread which calls the exception of the issue I just moved the use of the RecipientFactory inside the AsyncTask we use later this is also the place where we need the recipients the first time Direct reply still works as intended after this change Related Issue

column2: WikiLeaks Signal communications vulnerable on unlocked devices
column3: If this is the wrong place for this sorry please close I was reading more about the recent WikiLeaks dump PRESS and noticed this from a Q A section in an article Q The documents suggest that the CIA can access information in encrypted messaging apps like WhatsApp and Signal I thought they were safe from even government spying A No system is perfect The documents describe ways to get information in those apps on Android devices but only after gaining full control of those phones Even if the method is not yet available disclosed I thought it may be prudent to have a discussion or at least an open issue on the matter If there is any way these leaks can highlight shortfalls in Signal and thus help to improve its information security there may be some good from it

column2: Encrypted SMS MMS without Data Connection
column3: file this under Feature Request This would seem like a no brainer but I guess it needs to be spelled out Once two people or a group has a shared key and all further communications are encrypted if the person needs to turn off data for whatever reasons they should be able to continue to send and receive encrypted texts and MMS The application should be able to understand that a TCP connection is not available and thus either wrap the encrypted message in a MMS envelope or encrypt it into small 160 character blocks and send it via SMS Incoming messages should be parsed regularly and decrypted once a proper envelope appears There have been times people were caught off guard because they turned off their mobile data wifi and missed out on important comms If the application knew to retry via SMS MMS then it would not be an issue unless they had no service whatsoever then it would sit in a queue But it should always retry periodically via SMS MMS until a data connection comes up

column3: This is a bug report template By following the instructions below and filling out the sections with your information you will help the developers to get all the necessary data to fix your issue You can also preview your report before submitting it You may remove sections that are not relevant to your particular case Before we begin please note that this tracker is only for issues not questions or comments If you are looking for support please see our support center instead or email support whispersystems org Let is begin with a checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly I have X searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description Family uses Signal to communicate but Teenager has limited cellular data e g used up monthly quota on YouTube Other family members cannot send messages to Teenager in a timely fashion without knowing in advance whether Teenager currently has cellular data available Steps to reproduce Attempt to send Signal message to Teenager Message is sent fine one tick Hours later notice that Teenager has not replied and message still has only one tick Manually send message via long press SMS Actual result Teenager does not actually receive the message until it has been manually been sent via SMS Expected result An app setting should allow automatic fallback to SMS MMS if the message has not been delivered to the recipient after N minutes Signal would ideally need a way to identify when two copies are received one via SMS MMS and one via Signal when cellular or Wifi permits the original message to arrive For many people the encrypted nature of Signal messages is less important than a single reliable messaging app and these people are nonetheless important for growing the Signal user base BTW I found some old bugs about fallback if the senders internet is intermittent but not the receivers

column2: Debouncing send button
column3: Added simple debouncing of the send button by disabling it in the click listener and enabling it again when text is entered Fixes 6076 Contributor checklist x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices LG Nexus 4 Android 5 0 2 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description The send button can be pressed twice in quick succession leading to sendMessage being called twice This method handles the InvalidMessageException thrown by trying to send an empty message and shows a Toast to the user I added simple debouncing by disabling the button in the SendButtonListener is onClick method and it is then re enabled in updateToggleButtonState to ensure the button can be pressed after text has been entered or an attachment has been added The original bug report suggested that the attachment popup should appear but I do not believe this is really desired behavior It seems unlikely that a user would purposefully tap the button twice in such quick succession intending to go from sending one message to adding an attachment I believe it is more likely to happen by accident hence the debouncing approach

column2: No means to change audio stream to Bluetooth headset after establishment
column3: When a Bluetooth audio device is already connected and selected for call audio Signal uses it just fine However when you want to swap an already established call to a Bluetooth headset there is no means to do so without disconnecting the call and establishing a new one In addition when you start a call on Bluetooth and then wander out of range such as might happen when you leave your phone in your vehicle at a gas station many phones will silently redirect the call back to the standard ear speaker In these cases when you get back out to the vehicle these phones typically will reconnect with the Bluetooth headset but will not redirect the call audio back to the headset So in addition to the speakerphone option I would like to see a Bluetooth option that would attempt to change the call audio stream to a Bluetooth headset Security considerations This could potentially pose a threat when there is a Bluetooth sniffer near the phone that is trying to use Bluetooth given the differences between Bluetooth encryption and Signal encryption It does not impact security of the call stream over the cellular or wifi networks This would seem to be no more risky than the current state of being willing to use a Bluetooth headset if it is configured before the call starts Please do not take Bluetooth functionality away several of my contacts will refuse to use Signal any longer if they cannot use it with their Bluetooth headsets

column2: Honor synced end session messages
column3: If Desktop resets a session the remote party will delete all sessions with our number including any with the Android client Thus when the android client receives a synced sent message with its end session flag set it too should close all sessions with the destination and render the message as Secure session reset Currently it renders as a normal message and does not delete sessions

column2: notifications disappear on android 7 1 1 signal 3 28 4
column3: Bug description notifications disappear and messages automatically marked read on android 7 1 1 february security update with signal 3 28 4 Steps to reproduce send message to handset from other signal client another device or the chrome application first notification appears normally send another message notification pops up and message is immediately marked as read automatically without user intervention and notification disappears send another message notification never appears all messages have been received when viewed in the application they are marked as read though the conversation was never opened this behavior only happens with signal messages not sms or mms sms and mms messages are notify correctly and remain unread Actual result notifications do not appear and messages automatically marked as read Expected result notifications appear and remain until the message is read by the user Screenshots Device info Device Google Pixel Android version 7 1 1 Signal version 3 28 4 Link to debug log there was not anything interesting in the debug log so i did not post it plus this bug has a deterministic repro it happens every time

column2: Feature Request Move to SQLCipher so destination information is also encrypted
column3: Improve local storage encryption Now only the content of the messages is encrypted If forensics can bypass androids FDE they can collect metadata Please do not assume that androids FDE is safer than local encryption implemented right Android FDE is light years away from ios and even ios is not bulletproof please read on the discoussion forum Moxie commented he would want to phase it out in favor of android fde Wich would be a mistake

column2: Keep screen on during audio playback
column3: Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Sony Xperia U Android 4 4 4 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description 4424 demands a wake lock for audio attachment playback But a wake lock alone wo not do the trick A CPU in awake state will not be helpful if audio playback is stopped in onPause which is triggered when the screen turns off and should definitely include stopping audio playback So I decided to implement a simple workaround that keeps the screen on during audio playback WhatsApp for example continues its audio playback even when the screen turned off That is the behaviour we want for the future I think This PR is just an offer to slightly improve the situation Improves 4424 FREEBIE

column2: Signal update 4 1 0 wiped out lost erased entire message history without plain text backup or like
column3: Bug description I opened Signal after an automatic update to 4 1 0 It asked me to re initialize my phone number as if it were a new install Once it opened my message history was completely gone I re imported from the sms database and it only imported everything from before I installed Signal nearly 6 months ago I attempted to import from a text backup to see if the update had made one but it was not found It appears the message history is lost Steps to reproduce Allow Signal to auto update via the play store Open Signal It will ask you to re initialize your phone number Upon successful initialization find all of your messages lost Actual result All of my Signal message history was gone I was able to re import SMS messages from before installing Signal the first time over 6 months ago Expected result I would still have my SMS message history Device info Device Google Nexus 5 Android version 0 0 0 Signal version 6 0 1 Link to debug log

column2: UX Bugfix Improve consistency between global and recipient notification preferences
column3: Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Nexus 6P running 6 0 1 CM 13 0 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description Consistency is a widely accepted usability standard These changes are intended to improve the consistency in the Preferences related activities Use SwitchPreferenceCompat globally The current implementation mixes CheckBoxPreferences and SwitchPreferenceCompats for boolean preferences Toggle LEDs on off using a switch This holds consistency with the current method of toggling of Notifications on off via a switch with customization options following the switch In the current approach one must unintuitively choose Color None Bugfix Until now changing a recipient preference from Default to another ringtone and back will have a radio icon indicating that the previous other ringtone is currently selected never going back to Default Recipient specific default notification and vibration settings now say Signal default ACTUAL SETTING instead of just Default This reflects how the global notification setting also says Default ringtone SYSTEM DEFAULT Clean up Global notification summary field is not used rather it is set to the current ringtone by the RingtoneSummaryListener Removed this unused field If there is any particular change that you disagree with please notify me and I will remove it from the PR Before and After Global settings before Global before Global settings after Global after Contact settings before Contacts before Contact settings after Contacts after

column2: Signal incompatibility with NetGuard
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description Signal is unable to send or receive messages over an LTE 3G connection if NetGuard is active simultaneously on the device This behaviour persists even if Signal is given full access to both WiFi and cellular connections in NetGuard This behaviour is unique to cellular data connections Signal works properly on WiFi while NetGuard is active It is not yet clear whether the problem is in Signal or in NetGuard If it turns out to be the latter then a help faq page saying NetGuard breaks Signal there is just no way to make it work here are alternatives workarounds would be a good idea Running without NetGuard or a similarly capable alternative is not a workaround as that would permit other apps to quickly gobble up mobile data which in this case is expensive and in extremely limited supply Steps to reproduce Debug log attached generated as follows While an active WiFi connection is present close and then start Signal Verify that NetGuard is set normally firewall is on Signal has full access for both WiFi and cellular modes Move outside the range of the WiFi connection Device automatically switches to LTE connection Attempt to send a plain text message in Signal Actual result Get a failed to send message error Expected result Message is sent shows 1 checkbox sent shortly thereafter shows 2 checkboxes received Turn off NetGuard entirely Try sending the message again in signal Actual result Message is sent correctly Expected result No change Re enable NetGuard and move back into WiFi range Actual result Signal works normally Device info Device LGE Nexus 5 hammerhead Android version 6 0 1 Signal version 4 1 0 Link to debug log

column2: Missing possibility to manually insert the SMS registration code
column3: There are situations where the device where Signal is installed can not directly receive SMS messages but the users can receive the message on another device service Some devices do not have a sim card slot but the users owns another phone that can receive messages Other users want to register with a phone number bought from a service like Twilio In these cases it is difficult to register with the current procedure I propose this kind of solution After the 2 minutes SMS timeout a screen is shown to the user asking to manually enter the code receives via SMS The screen also have a clear button that says I did not receive any sms or something like that If the user taps on I did not receive the SMS the current voice verification screen is shown The vast majority of the users will never see this screen I think there are more users which can receive messages on a different device than users that try to register expect to receive the message but then something does not work

column2: UI issues with message composition in portrait landscape
column3: See for initial discussion Issues in portrait landscape The current compose hint is Send Signal message or Send unsecured SMS Send unsecured MMS which does not make much sense After tapping on the compose field the user types the message and does not send it Issues in landscape Same problem as in portrait with the compose hint Additionally the Send button uses the very same strings as the compose hint here it makes sense But these rather long strings make that button very wide taking far too much screen estate i e leaving not much room for the actual message content Suggested solution Separate the compose hint strings from the button text strings Use appropriate wording in the compose hint strings Wrap the button text strings into 3 lines so the button gets horizontally smaller and vertically larger leading to more screen estate for the message content on the left side of the button New lines n are already used by some currently existing Signal strings so should not be anything new for translators Suggested Compose Hint strings portrait landscape Type Signal message Type unsecured SMS Type unsecured MMS Suggested Button Text strings landscape Send nSignal nmessage Send nunsecured nSMS Send nunsecured nMMS Ideally the Send button in landscape should be colored signal blue for encrypted and gray for unencrypted messages But I understand this is not feasible right now

column2: Play services issue
column3: First of all I have never come across another app that wo not allow the user to bypass the update play services popup by clicking outside the popup and then work as normal if indeed the app does not REQUIRE play services but still attempts to use it for something Signal registration fails completely if play services is not the latest possible version even if the user has it disabled You should allow the user to click outside that popup and proceed without updating using play services if in fact Signal works without it That is what most apps do if they do not require play services Second your comment about Signal being designed to work if play services is not installed on the device at all is completely facetious ALL android devices have this installed The only way to get it completely deleted is to root the device which thanks to google can only be done by using third party apps like Kingroot which is made by unknown people in China and introduces a huge security risk Therefore it is only feasible to DISABLE play services google services framework the play store and google account manager Third you ask what is the benefit of making play services disabled if it is some kind of malware Well 1 play services constantly phones home to a google domain at 1e100 net It has complete permissions to your device and knowing how google is most likely uploads the user is contacts and files and may even record audio and video without the user knowing The mere fact that it has permission to do all of that is a security risk in itself and opens a backdoor for the government to collude with google to develop spy tools for Android phones 2 Play services is constantly updating which I have found can cause major incompatibility issues and brick phones since google does not test the update on every phone in use in the marketplace Google forces the updates on users which is unethical and unnecessary if the old version is working So hopefully you can see why play services is a major problem Basically google treats peoples' phones as if it belonged to google controlling what can run on the device forcing updates accessing god knows what and constantly phoning home as any user with a firewall app can see They act as if they are only licensing the phone to the user rather than the user actually owning the phone and controlling it Honestly I would think any developer working on a privacy security product like Signal would have grasped this already With regards to publishing annoucements see

column2: Fix copying links when scrolling in 6343
column3: You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor License Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Nexus 6P Android 7 1 2 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description reported an issue where links gets copied when the user starts scrolling starting from them The reason behind that issue was that the GestureDetector was not receiving the ACTION CANCELLED MotionEvent so it still called the onLongPress even though it should not This fix merely passes the ACTION CANCELLED MotionEvent to the GestureDetector so that it cancels its onLongPress handler

Setting disappearing messages in a group also removes entire group after messages expire
column3: This is a bug report template By following the instructions below and filling out the sections with your information you will help the developers to get all the necessary data to fix your issue You can also preview your report before submitting it You may remove sections that are not relevant to your particular case Before we begin please note that this tracker is only for issues not questions or comments If you are looking for support please see our support center instead or email support whispersystems org Let is begin with a checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description Caveat Please note I'm not entirely sure this is a bug as I could see the utility of this behavior depending on the use case When I'm in a group conversation with in this case two other users and I have set the disappearing messages timer to 1 day if that amount of time passes and no one has sent any messages to the group not only will the messages disappear as expected but the entire group will disappear no longer showing in the contacts list Steps to reproduce Create a messaging group with two other Signal users Set disappearing messages timer to 1 day Exchange messages as expected Note that your group appears in your contacts list Allow all messages to expire with no messages being sent or received by the group for the duration of the disappearing messages timer Note that the created group has disappeared Actual result Note that the created group has disappeared Expected result Noting my caveat above the expected result would normally be that the created group does not disappear without the user manually deleting it Work arounds you can drag and drop images below The following work arounds were found to negate this behavior assuming you do not want to disable the disappearing messages functionality When first creating the group prior to setting the disappearing messages timer send one message to the group serving to anchor the group in your contacts list Once that message has been sent set the disappearing messages timer which will automatically delete subsequent messages excluding the anchor It is unknown if this will serve to anchor the group with recipients especially if they manually delete the anchor Assuming you are using the desktop client where the group will not disappear once the timer has expired but messages will send a message to the group This will serve to recreate the group on the mobile app The group will disappear on the mobile app should the timer expire again App State Signal messages and calls registered SMS MMS Enabled Notifications on Passphrase on Screen security on Theme Dark Language Default Message trimming off 3rd party app info unknown other than being Signal registered Device info replace the examples with your info Device Huawei Nexus 6P Android version 7 1 2 build N2G47H Signal version 4 4 0 beta Link to debug log Bug was not noticed in a timely fashion so no debug log was generated

column2: Signal sounds and codecs
column3: I have X searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description Actually this is not a bug just proposal for UX improvement Current sounds sonar sound and ping when call is established terminated are by my opinion too aggressive They contain too much high tones My proposal is to use more soft sounds My proposal is also to replace sonar sound with something more similar to ringing for instance instead of sonar there should be slow ringing and when ringing starts there should be regular ringing as it is now Another proposal is also to measure bandwidth and quality of call When quality of call starts to get to low user should get a very soft beep beep beep sound so he she is alerted there are problems with bandwidth This should also be visible on the screen If connection drops because of bad connection it should be re establisher automatically user should be alerted of this re establishing by sound and by screen text Anyway I am also noticing some problems with bandwidth consumption Are there any plans that when bad network conditions occur codec automatically switches to lower quality I am not talking about VBR codecs just that maybe there should be two codecs used one for normal bandwidth and another when bandwidth is lower

column2: Refactor storage management to have a centralized clearer way to get the Signal output directories
column3: FREEBIE First time contributor checklist x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor License Agreement Contributor checklist x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Sony Xperia Z5 Compact Android 7 0 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description This is just some refactoring base on the observation that the storing policy is not completely clear in the code Every time something needs to be saved on the sdcard we see some Environment getExternalStorageDirectory calls and checks for errors I believe this belongs to utils both for clarity and for centralizing the access to the file storage Moreover this refactoring is supposed to help for issues 2791 and 5364 I believe that more refactoring should be done on the SaveAttachmentTask in order to make it testable I would move the decryption logic out of it and make it get directly an InputStream so that instrumented tests could try to write attachments on the sdcard without taking care of the encryption

NewConversationActivity conversation list hit pencil button GroupCreateActivity group conversation menu update group conversation list menu create group InviteActivity conversation list menu invite friends choose contacts There are several types of contacts that have to be distinguished Signal contacts which only have Signal registered numbers associated primary numbers semi Signal contacts which have Signal registered numbers and ones that are not registered secondary numbers non Signal contacts This PR affects the visibility of those secondary numbers in NewConversationActivity and GroupCreateActivity It does not affect InviteActivity see screenshots number NewConversation GroupCreateActivity Invite Signal reg primary x x o Signal reg secondary x before o x before o o non Signal contact no x x x Fixes 5311 FREEBIE Commit description The first commit fixes the contact list in NewConversationActivity But it also has the effect that the secondary numbers of Signal users are shown in InviteActivity The second commit uses the old query for InviteActivity and the new one for NewConversationActivity That means secondary numbers of Signal users are no more shown in InviteActivity as before Contact filtering is then completely moved to the database queries The method filterNonPushContacts was redundant before and is not useful afterwards either Screenshots before column2: Improve use of space in the message view
column3: This is a bug report template By following the instructions below and filling out the sections with your information you will help the developers to get all the necessary data to fix your issue You can also preview your report before submitting it You may remove sections that are not relevant to your particular case Before we begin please note that this tracker is only for issues not questions or comments If you are looking for support please see our support center instead or email support whispersystems org Let is begin with a checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description These are small issues but I think they could have some impact on user experience Here they are in order of importance 1 There is too much empty space between messages from the same person The amount of space is OK for messages from two different people but that space is too much for messages from the same person I often express my point in several consecutive messages and the spaces are breaking the flow Right now you could fit about two extra lines between the text of two consecutive messages 3 Similarly it is not necessary to display the profile picture for every message In one on one chat you actually do not need the pictures at all But I'm less sure if this is actually an issue Actual result a lot of space between messages which interrupts the flow of conversation Expected result good use of space

column2: Track verified safety numbers
column3: Signal should remember that you have verified safety numbers with a contact When you run into a friend it is easy to forget whether you have done this or not and anything to make it more convenient increases security Some users add a check mark to the contact is name but this is a terrible solution This change should not require any new options or settings It would be nice for both users to see a Your safety number with XXX was verified not verified message in the conversation in the style that you already see e g Your safety number with XXX has changed to see an indication of whether the safety number for any given contact has been verified in Conversation settings verify safety number and perhaps also additional info about it e g when verification occurred how to have some ongoing visual indication of the verification status within each conversation maybe the lock and checkmarks could become green instead of grey or there could be a different color in the title bar or background color I'm guessing it is unwise though to prevent someone from re verifying a safety number with a contact in case e g their threat model includes physical tampering Thanks for considering this

column2: UX Passphrase protect and hide only sensitive contacts
column3: As part of an intermediate threat level model I would like to have like in GO SMS Pro for example the passphrase protection apply only to a subset of my contacts conversations which should not affect normal usage of the app for the rest of the conversations in any way The sensitive conversations should only show up and be available to interact with when the passphrase is entered For this to happen of course there needs to be an entirely different handling of the passphrase protection or just a new dedicated contacts hiding passphrase mechanism where it does not auto lock the whole app but only some conversations In this case I should have something like an Unlock option in the Settings menu rather than as the first thing shown on app launch The scenario I'm thinking of is probably a quite common one where you expect to forget your phone on a table somewhere and to have people looking through it while you are gone In that case it is not much of a problem if they can get past the lockscreen but it becomes more important that a few apps or app sections holding sensitive information be really locked down with something more complicated than what is typically available as a screen locker If I complicate the screen locker by making it a long PIN or passphrase I severely reduce the usability of my phone and in my opinion it is the same with my SMS handling app which should be able to deal with inocuous conversations quickly and easily even if I have other conversations that I want to keep under a tighter lock As for new message notifications from the hidden contacts they should have some generic new message text that does not disclose either the contact is name or the contents of what they have sent you

column2: Resolve media message race condition
column3: Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Sony Xperia U Android 4 4 4 CyanogenMod AVD Nexus 5X Android 7 1 1 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description Rationale is describe in issuecomment 304039291 This PR makes sure that insertListener onComplete is called before notifyConversationListeners I see two possibilities to achieve this Move insertListener onComplete to insertMediaMessage L961 That is what I did The only disadvantage I see is changing the method signature of insertMediaMessage which is used in two other places Move or copy notifyConversationListeners to insertMessageOutbox L866 This method is used when sending a media message sending a self message and receiving messages So by moving this method call we maybe miss to notify in some cases Copying the method call will cause redundant notify calls My intuition says that this alternative is slightly more risky or error prone I tested sending messages in groups no duplicates as described in 6677 sending self messages behaviour seems unchanged receiving messages while the according conversation is showing behaviour seems unchanged Fixes 6677

column2: suggestion Making signal server world readable
column3: I respect that Signal is trying to improve the state of secure communications and is designed in such a way as to minimize the amount of metadata available to Open Whisper Systems but because it is not a federated protocol all Signal users must trust that Open Whisper Systems is telling the truth While we have no reason to doubt that it would be better not to have to operate solely on trust There should be no downside to making Signal is servers world readable except for API keys of course so that users can verify for themselves that all messages are encrypted and minimal metadata are stored

column2: Feature Request Let users choose between GCM PUSH and the new WEBSOCKET based notifying service
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Feature description Most of signal messages I send to my buddies only get delivered or calls tried notified when their signal app is opened This was the case with me until I moved to AOSP and with the new solution for non play services users now the messages come in very swiftly even when the app is not in foreground All my buddies are on stock rom and I understand there may be issues with play services configuration etc But not everyone are geeks and everyone cannot move to AOSP for different reasons and not everyone can or wants to contact support with debug log when there are good alternatives for instant messaging already installed on their phones So if the affected users have ability to choose between type of notifying services GCM PUSH or the WEBSOCKET one it would simply overcome the issues of no sluggish notifications and message delivery

column2: Marked as verified status messages should not be shown in groups
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description Marking a contact as verified or unverified generates a status message in each conversation the contact is in But both actions are manually and deliberately carried out by the user so I think that one status message in the one to one conversation is enough Steps to reproduce choose a contact that is member of several groups mark that contact as verified check the conversation list Actual result All conversations that the contact is in have a new status message and thus jump to the top of the conversation list however old the group conversation may have been Expected result Only show a status message in the one to one conversation Maybe it would still be somewhat helpful to generate a status message in a group once all group members have been verified Device info replace the examples with your info Signal version 4 7 0

column2: SMS based safety number verification
column3: So here is the idea now that we have persistent identity verification an SMS based safety number verification can be implemented Of course this is not as good as a face to face meeting where the numbers are checked but the only way to perform a MITM is to control both the Signal server and the mobile carrier in order to manipulate the SMS message exchange This is very unlikely remember that the SSL certificate of the server is pinned I think that an attack of this kind is less likely than getting the device compromised In this case encryption is not of any help

column2: Automatically check verification status after qrcode scan
column3: Backgrund PR This could be automated like this 1 The QR code contains the safety number and a random password valid only while the QR code page is open 1 Device A scans Device B is QR code checks the number marks it as verified and sends an acknowledgement message to device B authenticated by the temporary password 1 If the password matches device B sets the number as verified too as the acknowledgement message can only come from a device that physically scanned the QR code deserves some love too Thanks for the great features 4 7 0 brought Edit thinking about it the temporary password probably does not need to be temporary at all just random and per contact

column2: Notify if user does not receive mesage in a certain amount of time
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read When the message is sent the first tick acknowledges that the message was sent correctly and if there is an error the notification alerting the user appears after some time The second tick acknowledges the correct reception of the message and it would be great to have an option to notify the user if message is not received even after some time a few days for example It usually indicates dead phone or battery that the recepient is no longer available on Signal wrong recepient or even some exotic bug in the system etc Therefore it would be very practical to have a notification popping up alerting the user that message has not been received even after some time I also suggest this time be adjustable and 1 day as the default setting

column2: Remove race condition between GUI and ringtone
column3: This fixes 6356 6406 There is a race condition between IncomingRinger turning the speakerphone on to play the ringtone and WebRtcCallActivity which disables and unchecks the speakerphone button on the call screen during an incoming call If your phone can create and display the dialog quickly enough for it to needlessly turn the speakerphone off before IncomingRinger turns the speakerphone on you get a ringtone If it takes your phone too long to wake up create the lockscreen and then bring up the dialog then no ringtone or a very brief ringtone for you This patch removes the unchecking of the control buttons for speakerphone bluetooth videomute and audiomute when there is an incoming call They are still disabled but they are left in the default states so no extra events get thrown to the listeners You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works There is a race condition between IncomingRinger turning the speakerphone on to play the ringtone and WebRtcCallActivity which disables and unchecks the speakerphone button on the call screen during an incoming call If your phone can create and display the dialog quickly enough for it to needlessly turn the speakerphone off before IncomingRinger turns the speakerphone on you get a ringtone If it takes your phone too long to wake up create the lockscreen and then bring up the dialog then no ringtone or a very brief ringtone for you This patch removes the unchecking of the control buttons for speakerphone bluetooth videomute and audiomute when there is an incoming call They are still disabled but they are left in the default states so no extra events get thrown to the listeners

column2: Signal Android x86 VM Does not work with Lan connection
column3: x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read I installed the Signal apk from the WhisperSystems website Signal 4 7 4 on Android X86 in a virtual machine and linked it with the Chromium app so far so good Even so the linking process worked pretty fine it turned out that all the other functionality in Signal on Android x86 is not working at all like sending text messages or esp calling other signal users That is probably because Android x86 in a Virtualbox uses the LAN interface NIC to connect to the internet and it seems like the Signal Android app expects a WiFi connection instead of a LAN connection Could you please try to find a solution so that people could use the Signal Android App on Android x86 to call their contacts of course a solution for the Signal Chromium Desktop App would be preferable Bug description Signal is not able to just use an Android LAN connection for sending receiving messages or making calls Steps to reproduce Install Signal apk on Android x86 just with LAN connection Open Siganl app send message call person Expected result sending the message Device info Device innotek GmbH VirtualBox android x86 Android version 6 0 1 Signal version Signal 4 7 4 Link to debug log 3sfd

column2: isLowMemory should use getLargeMemoryClass not getMemoryClass

column2: Possible security issue Whilst de registering foreign number in UAE messages are sent received
column3: Bug description While registered with Signal on a foreign number and visiting UAE Signal does not work so whilst de registration of foreign number messages that were not being sent received are suddenly sent received in that time window Is there a possible vulnerability just during that time frame Steps to reproduce Use a SIM card from a foreign country where Signal is not blocked or censored and register and use it in that country Go to UAE and use Signal messages will not be sent Send a few messages and instantly go to next step Try de registering it will give an error of error connecting to server Previously sent messages will be delivered whilst the de registration is happening Messages will not be sent anymore afterwards and de registration wo not happen Messages sent from outside UAE are also not delivered normally but are received whilst the UAE user is de registering Actual result So messages are not being sent received at all but then when trying to de register the messages are sent received The main problem here is that during de registration all messages are sent received Expected result Not sure what I expect but if Signal is blocked then messages should not go through at all So maybe it is a security issue or perhaps there is another way to circumvent censorship Screenshots Sorry no screenshots as the explanation is self sufficient hopefully Device info replace the examples with your info Device Samsung Galaxy S7 Android version 7 0 Signal version 4 8 1 Link to debug log

column2: Texts not delivered to users who get new phones and do not reinstall Signal
column3: x I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates Bug description Scenario Someone is using Signal then switches to a new phone but doesn t reinstall re set up Signal Issue I send them a text message through Signal The lock symbol appears so the message is being routed through Signal the first checkmark the message was sent appears but I never get the second checkmark the message was delivered I have run into this issue with at least 3 people in the last week In addition to the problem itself it is additionally problematic that there is no notification the message was never delivered I only discover it when I go to text that person again days or weeks later and even then it often takes me a few more instances before I notice what is going on Steps to reproduce Set up Signal on a phone Drop phone in toilet Get a new phone do not set up Signal Have someone else send you a text message Actual result The recipient does not receive any message The sender does not receive a notification their message failed to deliver Expected result Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above i e what would be the correct behaviour The text message would be routed to the recipient is normal text message app OR The sender would be notified the text message could not be delivered Platform info replace examples with your info Operating System LG G6 Android 7 0 Signal version 4 9 9

column2: Feature Request Nicknames in groups
column3: When joining a new group it is sometimes hard to find out which people belong to which phone number Asking everyone in the group who they are is tedious It would be nice to be able to set a nickname in the app that is sent in an extra field in each group message The receiving clients could show this nickname if the number has no associated contact Setting a nickname would of course be optional and the nickname is only sent in group messages Other messengers support this as well and it is very useful to find out who the person is that just sent a message in a group

column2: Feature Request Improve group message delivery confirmation

column2: Disable Screen security by default
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Feature description It is quite common to see non passphrase users wonder why screenshots in Signal do not work It probably does not make sense to have Screen security enabled by default for them For passphrase users it makes sense One option would be to remove the feature completely from settings and make it an implicit feature which depends on the passphrase setting In issuecomment 41502999 moxie0 wrote The Screen security feature i s not designed to prevent screenshots it is designed to notify the task manager that it should not cache screenshots of conversations The side effect is that it prevents screenshots

column2: Overall Privacy Compromise Created by Profile Feature
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Not really sure how to report this I deem that it belongs here since it is not a support request and is an issue with Signal But it it is considerably more general than other bug reports I have read all of the issue tickets reporting issues with the new profile feature and all of them identify issues with the way the feature was implemented None of them speak to the addition of this feature itself as problematic I use Signal because it is still the project with the most diligent commitment to smartphone messaging privacy I have until now had high confidence that Signal development decisions would be smart and levelheaded and would not compromise my privacy The addition of the profile feature has shaken that confidence The announcement of the Profile feature in Beta which I have only now had a chance to read claims All of this is possible without sacrificing the privacy and security that you have come to expect from Signal This is not true Half of my contacts know me by one name half by another It is imperative that there is no crossover between these identities Furthermore the gmail account my Android phone is registered under is a third identity Disclosing that identity to some Signal contacts would represent a catastrophic privacy breach which could even hypothetically endanger my life Up until now there has been no cause for concern in using Signal as enforcing the segregation of these identities has presented no issues Signal is design decisions have never presented any threat to this segregation because the presumption has always been in favour of privacy The set up your profile wizard which announced itself after the update prepopulated the name field with the name associated with my Google account It would have been very easy to have accidentally accepted this as my profile name As per the Signal blogpost this name would then have been visible to all contacts saved in my phone This decision thoughtlessly left me a single mistake away from a catastrophic privacy breach The Do It Later option was minuscule and dangerously close in the UI to the very large Accept button It was initially not visible to me so it looked as if I was being forced to choose a unitary identity for a Signal instance where I was managing multiple identities When I did spot it after a reinstall several attempts to press it on my large smartphone screen were unsuccessful It took multiple attempts Before I discovered the Do it later option my compromise attempt to save an empty profile returned an error message I also discovered after temporarily choosing a privacy preserving pseudonymous profile name which would nevertheless appear highly incongruous to several of my contacts that it is not possible to delete an identity once chosen There is no option to do so and if you try to save an empty profile it gives you an error So I had to reinstall the app to delete my profile And when you do not set up a profile the app harrasses you with persistent notifications to do so during group conversations as if the decision not to is assumed to be a temporary one by the Signal devs There are several bug reports which suggests mitigations for some of these different problems although not all of them e g I have seen no mention of the prepopulation of the name field as a concern Fixing each of these problems would indeed have reduced the severity of the threat to privacy represented by the introduction of the feature I also imagine there are people who believe that simply adding support for multiple profiles would solve the issue but in my opinion this would drastically sophisticate the task of managing identities and result in accidental breaches But fixing each of those issues would not address what seems to me the major issue that this issue was so thoughtlessly introduced at all Yes it is clear that to preserve my privacy Signal devs decided it would be unwise to just automatically create a profile for me based on the name associated with my Gmail account Instead I was given a dialogue with the name prepopulated But this in itself was dangerous and the fact that I was subjected to even this danger with apparently no consideration of how it could affect people with multiple identities leaves me with little confidence that similar or worse breaches might be thoughtlessly created in the future in order to introduce some convenience feature which is secondary to the goal of a truly private messaging application Using Signal is now fraught with inherent risk and I am no longer confident that Signal devs have my privacy as their priority For me a Signal user whose privacy is paramount this profile feature is not a feature but a bug The utility added to the app by the profile feature eliminating unknown phone numbers in group conversations seems to address an edge case at best It does not enhance the privacy of the user its only effect on user privacy is to make privacy compromise more likely I cannot see how its addition necessitates the attendant complexification of the task of staying private while using the app And the reasoning behind its introduction in a dev team with a commitment to privacy is entirely opaque to me I submit this issue as a Signal user who values privacy and who has experienced a privacy scare because of Signal development decisions something which I am sure should be of concern to a privacy oriented project It is considerably longer than a typical bug report because it speaks to a broader issue If this issue can be taken on and used to improve matters that is to the good If it is simply the case that Signal is reprioritising or that it does not intend to cater to users like me with harder privacy requirements than the average but privacy conscious user that is sad to me but I accept it But it also suggests to me that it is misleading to call it Signal Private Messenger and to entice users with more stringent needs into a potentially risky situation

column2: Periodically prod the message pipe when GCM is disabled
column3: Added an AlarmManager alarm to periodically prod the SignalServiceMessagePipe waking any threads that may be stuck in blocking wait while the device sleeping Fixes 6644 FREEBIE You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor License Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Xiaomi Mi 4 Android 7 1 2 LineageOS 14 1 w o GCM support Motorola Moto G3 Android 7 1 2 LineageOS 14 1 w o GCM support Motorola Moto G 3rd gen Android 6 0 1 with GCM support x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description This pull request implements a fix to the problems described in 6644 using the facilities implemented in WhisperSystems libsignal service java 45 Please see the referenced pull request for a detailed description of the problem and most of the proposed solution As far as this pull request is concerned a periodic alarm is set up to prod and awaken the pipe which in the absence of GCM will generally be trapped in blocking wait The period is set to 60s because that is the smallest period allowed by AlarmManager As a result the keep alive period on the socket is side had to be increased to match Note that in the proposed solution Allowance is made for the co existence of more than one pipes or at least more than one MessageRetrievalThread s which as far as I could determine can be the case Prods are only enabled in the absence of GCM If it is deemed that they would be beneficial on GCM enabled devices as well see the relevant discussion in WhisperSystems libsignal service java 45 this can trivially be accommodated by unconditionally creating and registering the alarm receiver

column2: Attached image from camera leaves plaintext copy
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description When attaching an image directly from the camera a plaintext copy of the image is saved to the folder storage emulated 0 Android data org thoughcrime securesms files Steps to reproduce Go into any Signal conversation Leave the message empty Press the blue paperclip button this does not happen when you press the quick camera button Press the green Camera button Take a picture Press the tick or similar button in the camera app to accept the picture No need to continue editing captioning or sending the image the file has already been created and is never removed Even deleting the draft does not delete the file Actual result A file with a jpg extension is created in the folder storage emulated 0 Android data org thoughcrime securesms files the file name is made of the digits of what appears to be ctime of the time the file was created The file persists throughout the life of the app and never deleted even when the image in the conversation is deleted or the entire conversation is deleted Clearing Signal is storage from the app info applet does delete all files in that folder Expected result Ideally No plaintext image file would be created anywhere within the phone is file system Alternatively the file will be deleted as soon as practicable after it has been encrypted and stored in Signal is database Device info Device Tested on OnePlus 2 and Samsung Galaxy S7 Android version Tested under OxygenOS Stock 3 6 0 for Oneplus 2 and Cyanogen 14 1 NIGHTLY for S7 Signal version 4 9 9 and based on the pictures left on my device multiple previous versions

column2: Ability to choose preferred SIM for SMS on a per contact basis dual SIM
column3: I have X searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description When using a dual SIM Android phone un encrypted text messages SMS are sent from the primary SIM card even when all received text messages from this contact were received by the secondary SIM Steps to reproduce SIM1 is the primary SIM with the data connection SIM2 is the secondary SIM without data connection In my case Signal was registered using the number of SIM2 However sending receiving encrypted messages via SIM1 only works flawlessly thanks open existing conversation of a contact which does not use Signal yet this contact does only know my SIM2 number and thus the whole conversation so far was written to and sent by my SIM2 send an un encrypted text message without manually switching the send button to SIM2 SIM1 is always selected and used by default Actual result the contact gets my message from my SIM1 phone number which she did not recognize my text message gets misinterpreted as spam which results in a failed conversation Expected result my text message gets sent via SIM2 as before and my contact recognizes my number IMHO this can be accomplished in two ways 1 Signal asks me once per un encrypted conversation which SIM I want to use for this contact This can be modified in the conversation settings 2 Signal analyses the conversation so far and if a every or b the most recent ones or c the previous message was sent from SIM2 use SIM2 as long as I manually do not switch the SIM for this conversation I would go with 2 c because it seems to be the most intuitive solution without additional UI elements for switching default SIM in the conversation settings Device info Device OnePlus 5 Android version 7 1 1 Signal version 4 9 9

column2: Feature discussion Blockchain verified conversations
column3: This discussion really applies to the entire Signal stack but it had to put someplace Also I'm not entirely sure signal does not already have something like this Signal does a great job at client e2e encryption People mostly seem excited about it is ability to prevent people from listening in on conversations Aside from encryption GPG also gives us verification that the message originated from a specific individual I'm curious what is that verification was taken one step further What if a blockchain of sorts was kept for each conversation This way we enforce the order in which messages were sent and most importantly that message b came directly after message a Deletion or insertion of messages after the fact would not be possible Such an implementation would ensure a conversation remains the same between all parties involved and that no individual could inject or remove parts of conversations without the other parties involved noticing An example of something like this is how git handles commits Each commit contains a hash of the current commit and diff and the hash of the previous commit A simple program can then run against the commits to verify the repo is in good order In Signal is case a central authority would be necessary So the hash chain would probably need to exist on the server The clients can sync against the hash chain and verify their local conversations match the server is Thoughts

column2: switching between secure and insecure persists between contacts
column3: I have a few contacts that still have Signal installed in hopes of bugs like being resolved but do not prefer Signal for their daily driver until the application is usuable for them Which for users that are experiencing this iOS bug the application is insanely frustrating to use Signal rightfully defaults to messaging being secure However when I switch to insecure for this contact move to another contact the method of delivery is still insecure This is also true the other way around If I switch that contact back to secure and then go to the contact that prefers insecure iMessage conveniences etc then the delivery is set to secure Steps to reproduce 1 Open Signal contact A send insecure message 2 Open Signal contact B message defaults to insecure 3 Change delivery of message for Signal contact B back to secure 4 Switch to Signal contact A message delivery now set to secure due to action in step 3 I would like to see a per conversation or per contact preference for delivery of secure vs insecure An additional remind confirm insecure messages in x days hours would also be awesome

column2: Fixes an issue that was causing the per recipient notification sound
column3: to not be able to be set to none and default was functioning as none Fixes 7115 You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor License Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Nexus 5X Android 8 0 0 Virtual Device Samsung S8 Android 7 1 1 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit FREEBIE Description Describe briefly what your pull request proposes to fix Especially if you have more than one commit it is helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works The original error was that users were not able to set none for the per recipient notification sound Upon investigation I found that the app was setting the default uri to null which caused issues because the default uri on devices is not null and is valid while none corresponds to a null uri This makes sense too because the default sound plays noise therefore must have a uri that references the sound file on the device while the none setting does not play any noise and so can have a null uri

column2: Feature Request Signed Encrypted Backup Signal Apk
column3: I have an idea to overcome the lack of the encrypted backup functionality Problem The problem with encrypted backups is that you can only do them if you compile your own instance of signal which can not be installed over an existing installation and can not be easily updated An encrypted backup of an existing official signal installation is not possible but necessary The titanium backup way requires rooted phones which is not feasable every time Since this issue has been open for years now without a usable sollution i propose a simple workaround that does not cost many ressources Suggested Feature The signal developers that hold the key used to sign the official apks could provide a version where encryted backups are enabled This version could be installed over the existing signal installation on non rooted phones and would finally enable users to migrate signal to a new phone without root obviously Expected outcome No more whining about missing functionality Development of a clean sollution can go on without stress Footnote Maybe hide the apk download a bit and mark ist as unstable so people wont complain if it does not work in their case

column2: Intrusive confusing notifications on Android 8 1 without Google Play Services
column3: I have X searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description On devices without Google Play Services Signal creates a notification to inform the user that a background connection has been established to the Signal servers On earlier versions of Android pre 8 1 this notification was present but low priority and therefore did not have an icon in the status bar and did not show up on the lock screen It only was visible in the expanded notification drawer On Android 8 1 however the background connection notification is visible in both the status bar and the lock screen notification view Furthermore it uses the same icon as incoming Signal messages creating the effect that a message notification is always present and causing user confusion See annotated screenshots Steps to reproduce run Signal on a device running Android 8 1 without Google Play Services look at the lock screen or status bar Actual result background connection notification is shown in the status bar and lock screen Expected result background connection notification should only be shown in the notification drawer and the Signal icon should not be present per previous versions Screenshots Standard usage of the device without any dismissable message notifications The icon in the status bar is from the background connection notification screenshot 20171207 232132 Standard usage of the device with an undismissed notification Note how two Signal icons are present in the status bar one from the message and the other from the background connection notification screenshot 20171207 232226 The expanded notification drawer screenshot 20171207 232236 Irrelevant sections of screenshots removed for privacy Device info Device Google Pixel Android version 8 1 0 without Google Play Services running CopperheadOS like raw AOSP Signal version 4 13 6

column2: FR Integrated keyboard input Google Keyboard spying
column3: This may sound and even be overly paranoid but the most advanced encryption in the world is meaningless if using an input method like Google Keyboard with system wide microphone access and other permissions Tonight I had Signal open while watching a discussion on vegetarianism and magically I had a msg populated with I would die I was sick of being hungry I was sick of beans and rice I DID NOT write this or ever discuss this topic with the contact Perhaps it is just a random coincidence but it sounds quite a bit like the endless reports alleging Facebook listening in and serving ads based on ambient audio Regardless if it is a real security concern it could be a potential one A few ideas 1 Have the option for Signal to use it is own built in keyboard similar to those meant to circumvent keyloggers 2 There are apps like Microphone Block and Camera Block for Android which disable the microphone and camera on a system wide basis Replicating this functionality in Signal for a Get Smart Super Paranoia Cone of Silence Mode would be a great addition for those that trust Signal OWS but maybe not Google Keyboard Android This still obviously is not a 100 guarantee but could help shift the balance from ubiquitous surveillance to highly targeted surveillance where it should be and all we can realistically hope for

column2: Remove Contact Pic Preceding Messages From Within Individual Conversations
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Feature Request Could it be possible to remove the contact pic preceding every message chat bubble in a conversation in order to reduce the clutter and also make things consistent with the iOS and Desktop versions Detailed Description While the presence of contact pics before messages is helpful in group conversations but still overwhelming when multiple messages are sent by the same person in succession as mentioned in 964 they are extremely redundant and make the screen more busy in one to one conversations The colour of the chat bubbles is already an excellent method of distinguishing between messages While doing something along the lines of other messaging apps QKSMS Hangouts Facebook Messenger or Google Messenger is what 964 sought by requesting that successive messages from the same contact be bundled with the contact pic appearing only once for one message bundle I am suggesting going the WhatsApp route and doing away with contact pics entirely at least in individual conversation where they add very little especially in excess Doing so would have the added benefit of making the Android app consistent with the iOS and Desktop apps where the contact pic does not appear within conversations The desktop app instead displays the contact pic in the action bar which could be one alternate location for displaying the contact pic Also hopefully there should be no database issues in implementing this change like was mentioned in that other issue and that might expedite its implementation as it would be a purely UI move Screenshots Here are the iOS and desktop versions respectively screen322x572 unnamed Here is how WhatsApp handles things presently unnamed The contact pic is relegated to the action bar and messages bubbles only carry the name of the contact Of course even the name is not present in case of individual conversations but I could not get a screenshot of that on the Play Store
