column2: add search for finding newest matching message in a conversation
column3: Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices GT I9300 Galaxy SIII LineageOS 14 1 Android 7 1 Nexus 4 Api 25 Emulator Android 7 1 1 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description This PR addresses a part of 1232 Searching a text within a conversation So the use case You have sent me your address some time ago and I don t want to scroll through the whole chat history is addressed but the case Someone has sent me that address I don t remember in which conversation is not Iterating through all messages is not a very fast solution but still better than manual searching That s why only the loaded part of the conversation 500 messages by default is searched to get a fast feedback whether the information you re looking for is in the conversation or not if no match is found the user can decide to load the whole conversation and search again If you don t think that the user experience with this patch is good enough I m fine if you don t want to merge this PR but I considered this patch quite useful during the last month so I wanted to share it

column2: Domain Fronting for Iran
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description There are a couple of other issues 6468 5992 and WhisperSystems Signal iOS 2903 about this problem One of them has been closed and the other two could have been filed in a more structured way so I'm opening this one hoping we can move this conversation forward in a constructive way The problem is that Google App Engine blocks connection from Iran and this renders the anti censorship feature of signal useless for Iranian people This is important now as the authorities are trying to shut down all the secure messaging platforms following the uprising and economical protests Additionally Telegram the main social media and messaging app for Iranian people has been blocked recently and this gives us a golden chance to help people adopt Signal All it takes is to make sure all the Iranian numbers are being routed through a meek server that is not Google We at Tor have tested both Azure and Amazon and they work perfectly fine I assume this is gonna be the same with other major CDNs as well Steps to reproduce Try to connect to Signal servers from an Iranian IP address Actual result Connection fails due to censorship Expected result OWS needs to either switch to or add new meek servers on a platform that is not Google App Engine and Signal should automatically enable censorship circumvention feature for Iranian phone numbers 98 Device info replace the examples with your info Device Any device Android version Any device both Anodrid and iOS Here are some additional info for the curious mind and Please help us to enable and empower millions of vulnerable people to communicate securely with making this change

caused by a Signal Android bug that produces out of date prekeys For the full discussion including Scott is comments see here Example 1 One of those cases is decribed in issue 7154 and as luck has it I have just experienced this again a couple of minutes ago My Android device and Signal Desktop had been successfully linked for several months now but as I switched to a newly set up installation of Windows I had to install Sigal Desktop again and re link it to my phone So what I have done is 1 Installed Signal Desktop v1 1 on Windows 2 Deleted the the old link from the prior Windows installation from Signal Android 3 Went through the linking procedure on Signal Desktop Signal Android scanning QR code etc And bam I have received 2 badly encrypted messages from my own phone number on Signal Android As expected Signal Desktop did not sync anything It looks finished but there are no contacts available I have not done so yet but I know from experience that I can remedy this situation by resetting the secure session with my own phone number I later did and resetting the secure fixed the problem Example 2 I have a friend with whom I have successfully communicated via Signal Android Desktop me iOS him for many months But a week or so ago I have installed and configured Signal Desktop v1 1 on his notebook for the very first time At first all seemed well But from that very point in time on I suddenly only received badly encrypted messages from him Namely I received only badly encrypted messages from him independently from the device he was using I have received badly encrypted messages from him when he used his newly installed Signal Desktop and I have received badly encrypted messages from him when he was using Signal iOS which used to work without problems before linking it to Signal Desktop Interestingly this only happened when he communicated with me but not when he communicated with other contacts Again I have had to reset the secure session with him AND send him a message afterwards only resetting did not do the trick in order to fix it So I have definitely had my share of issues that could only be fixed by resetting the secure session I have had this happen on completely different devices and addtionally I have done clean installs of Signal on a fairly regular basis so it is not some fucked up installation My guess is that Signal Desktop is somehow bugged in that regard Update 2018 01 03 Example 3 A contact of mine installed set up Signal Android for the very first time in her life and directly after that sent me a message also her very first Signal message to anyone ever I have received that message as badly encrypted on Signal Android but it is readable on Signal Desktop See debug log for example 3 Steps to reproduce See above Screenshots N A column2: Allow swipe gestures in media preview
column3: Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Sony Xperia U Android 4 4 4 CyanogenMod AVD Nexus 5X Android 7 1 1 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in the commit message of my first commit Description Please read the commit messages to see which changes I applied The following problems remain Raise offscreen page limit of the viewPager to enable a smoother paging experience By default the viewed page plus one page to the right and one to the left is instantiated offscreen page limit 1 If you use a slow phone and swipe swiftly you will reach a page whose media are not yet instantiated You will see a black page which will display media with some latency We can try to solve this issue by raising the offscreen page limit to 2 In worst case you are still using a slow phone and 5 GIFs are now instantiated animated I observed that the animations get slow in this situation This could be solved by stopping GIF animations when GIFs are offscreen If you want this behaviour I will implement it Do we want to be able to switch pages when an image is zoomed in I implemented this feature in 5801 but decided to keep it out of this PR to keep the diff low On Android versions prior to Marshmallow no video thumbnails are created In media preview when swiping to a video the placeholder will be shown It has to be tapped to start video playback To make this clear we should show the play overlay above the placeholder This should go in a separate PR too 6635 The video thumbnails maybe should have the same size as the video and do not fill the whole screen Sadly I'm not able to test this contribution with the platforms that use the old video player which are Android versions 4 0 1 downwards see 6603 I would be happy if someone tested this PR using such a device Fixes 2355 Supersedes 5801

column2: Display the absolute time as an alternative to the relative time
column3: You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor License Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices OnePlus 3T Android 8 0 0 Virtual device Nexus One API 26 Virtual device Nexus One API 27 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax Description Describe briefly what your pull request proposes to fix Especially if you have more than one commit it is helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works This patch introduces the option to switch from relative time to absolute time in Conversation Item ListItem UpdateItem and MediaPreviewActivity The configuration option is available in Settings Chat and media Chats Default setting is false the relative time By changing to true the relative time will be switched to the absolute time This Pull Request is extending parts of the code where relative time is being called by get Brief Extended RelativeTimeSpanString First the check against the preferences is executed TextSecurePreferences isAbsoluteTimeEnabled getContext If absolute time is enabled getAbsoluteTimeSpanString instead of get Brief Extended RelativeTimeSpanString is called getAbsoluteTimeSpanString is defined in DateUtils and formats date to yyyy MM dd HH mm ss

column2: Media preview swipe gesture detection should behave more liberally
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description When holding the phone in one hand you will most often end up using that hand is thumb to swipe left and right Naturally this results in a gesture slightly diagonal e g from bottom left to top right and vice versa for the right hand rather than exactly horizontal The gesture detection fails in this case since it seems to expect a nearly horizontal move which is nearly impossible to accomplish in one hand usage Hence the gesture detection should be more liberal if the move direction is not absolutely accurate Besides of that a full screen mode that can be toggled would fit in fairly nice Steps to reproduce open media preview gallery hold phone in one hand and try to use that hand is thumb to swipe left right Actual result Gesture detection most often fails to recognize user gets frustrated Expected result Gesture detection succeeds to recognize and shows previous next media Device info Device Lenovo Moto G 4 Plus other devices as well Android version 7 0 Android 4 4 as well Signal version 4 15 0 Link to debug log

column2: Group security limit adding new contacts to existing members
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read This issue is about the recently published paper regarding flaws in end to end security in Signal and other messengers If I got it right then the described vulnerability is as follows The Signal client does not authenticate messages that add new members to a group So if the Group ID impossible to guess but known to the server and one group member are known to the attacker then she can send a group joining message to this contact and gets joined without further authentication I'm aware of Moxies response Here is how WhatsApp group messaging works but I'm not aware of a public statement by any of the OpenWhispersystems Signal developers regarding the evaluation of Signal group messaging by the paper My understanding is that in Signal there would be a fairly easy fix for the described vulnerability the Signal client could check whether the group joining request comes from an existing member of the group and deny the joining attempt if not Do you intend to implement this fix in Signal If not what is the rationale to not do so

column2: Display the absolute time as an alternative to the relative time
column3: You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor License Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices OnePlus 3T Android 8 0 0 Virtual device Nexus One API 26 Virtual device Nexus One API 27 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is Description Describe briefly what your pull request proposes to fix Especially if you have more than one commit it is helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works This patch introduces the option to switch from relative time to absolute time in Conversation Item ListItem UpdateItem and MediaPreviewActivity The configuration option is available in Settings Chat and media Chats Default setting is false the relative time By changing to true the relative time will be switched to the absolute time This Pull Request is extending parts of the code where relative time is being called by get Brief Extended RelativeTimeSpanString First the check against the preferences is executed TextSecurePreferences isAbsoluteTimeEnabled getContext If absolute time is enabled getAbsoluteTimeSpanString instead of get Brief Extended RelativeTimeSpanString is called getAbsoluteTimeSpanString is defined in DateUtils and formats a date to yyyy MM dd HH mm ss

column2: Signal No Longer Recognizes Android Contacts
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description The Signal application version 4 14 x and higher no longer recognizes any Android contacts on Sailfish devices that employ Alien Dalvik All previous versions worked fine All Signal messages and basic conversation features work but there is no visible association with contacts so no names or pictures appear Steps to reproduce Install Android support on Sailfish device Sailfish version 2 1 3 7 Install Signal Android application tested with 4 14 10 and 4 15 5 Open application and notice that all current conversations have as contact image as well as no names Actual result All current conversations have as contact image as well as no names Also the new message screen is unable to display any available contacts If an attempt is made to add a Contact from an existing conversation the following message appears There is no app available to handle this link on your device Expected result The Signal application should be able to interrogate the Android subsystem to automatically import contacts At the very least starting a new message conversation and selecting the Refresh menu should import contacts and associate them with existing conversations This unexpected behavior is not present with version 4 12 3 downgrading solves the issue However the older version will expire and is therefore not tenable as a long term solution Device info Device Sony Xperia X Android version 4 4 4 Signal version 4 15 5 Link to debug log I understand from reading several other bug reports that is not interested in supporting Sailfish or other non pure Android environments I also have read several of his comments lamenting the current broken state of PC security and security overall Many of his laudable efforts have improved security greatly for many people around the world However I propose that not supporting Sailfish and or Alien Dalvik while claiming to champion privacy and security are two opposing positions that do not comport Having an alternative platform free from corporate spying and other unsavory anti privacy features are essential to those wishing for improved privacy and security The Sailfish platform while imperfect provides a third way for the security conscious I understand that a great deal of resources cannot be committed to this tiny perhaps insignificant subset of devices in a sea of Android devices awash with greatly diverse hardware and versions but I ask that serious consideration be given to ensuring that basic Signal functionality is possible on the Sailfish platform Thanks

column2: playback of audio attachments behaves like active phone call
column3: Problematic functionality When playing an audio attachment within Signal if the proximity sensor is triggered then the screen shuts off and audio is played from the earpiece If the screen is turned off during playback playback stops If this is intended functionality I do not understand why this would be desired I know of no other applications that behave in this way save for with active phone calls This is related to this issue but goes further Example scenario 1 A user starts playback of an audio attachment Said user continues to read messages in that conversation while the audio plays While scrolling one of their fingers or any other random object happens to briefly move near the proximity sensor The screen turns off and then immediately back on and playback has stopped For a user who is not expecting this behaviour or does not know enough about proximity sensors to predict how they will function they try to play the audio again only to have the above scenario play out again This repeats 3 4 times after which they swear loudly give up in frustration and start harassing me for encouraging them to use Signal in the first place instead of a real app that works for normal people Example scenario 2 My phone is speaker is on the back of the device The audio attachment is long and I do not want to be holding my phone or have the screen on to conserve battery that whole time I want to turn off the screen put my phone down on a table screen facing down speaker facing up and do something else while I listen to the message This is currently impossible unless I download the audio file and play it using a different app Even if I leave the phone facing upward the screen will automatically shut off after 30 seconds stopping the playback Device info Many devices all but my particular device information is Device Samsung Galaxy S4 SHV E330S Android version 5 0 1 Signal version 4 15 5

column2: Feature Request Please bring back the ability to share with more than top 5 groups
column3: I have X searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description Ever since an update late last year when you would share something from other apps to Signal it would only give you the option to select the 5 most recent group chats Steps to reproduce In any other app tap the share three dot less than icon to share something a link an image audio In the list of available apps choose Signal User is presented with entire list of individual Signal contacts but only the last 5 recently used group chats Actual result Can only share with the 5 most recent group chats Expected result Ability to share with any and all group chats listed in chronological order Screenshots signal 2018 02 16 175038 Only two of my group chats are in the top 5 at the moment Three of the entries are individuals which is redundant since all individual contacts are accessible immediately below Another idea is if a combined abbreviated 'Recent Chats' section is desired add another comprehensive 'Group Chats' section as well The fact that any group chat is inaccessible from this interface is a real problem Device info replace the examples with your info Device OnePlus 5 Android version 7 1 2 LineageOS 14 1 20171009 Signal version 4 15 5 Link to debug log Feature restoration request The ability to share items with many groups was an important piece of functionality for me On any given day I am juggling multiple group discussions on Signal Often I have to share something with multiple groups in one instance including groups I may not have been active in for a while This often means attempting to share to Signal discovering the intended group is not in the top 5 then having to go back to the originating app copy the link or media to clipboard then back to Signal and manually paste Having to repeat this for many groups in one sitting is a frequent reality for me now and it is cumbersome and slow It is especially unwieldy when sharing media image audio video because often it precludes the ability to cut and paste so I have to switch out of the originating app go into Signal find the intended group type a period so that the group registers in the top 5 then return the originating app share choose Signal choose the group I urge you to avoid revisions that remove functionality I had been running a deprecated version of Signal to maintain this functionality but it expired forcing me to upgrade If there had been some concerns about the number of group chats listed in the share interface may I suggest that you add a setting to specify the number of group chats that get displayed set the default to 5 but allow the user to adjust it Thanks again for all your work in bringing Signal to society

column2: Upload Signal to F Droid Android FOSS catalogue
Optional ability to confirm have read
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read not following rest of template as this is a global feature request not a device specific bug report Whatsapp has a tick system One tick means the message has not yet been received Two ticks means it has been received Two blue ticks means the message was also displayed on screen and likely read For obvious reasons Signal Private Messenger does not have the blue ticks However I think it should have and it wont have to violate privacy I message my father on signal sometimes But he falls asleep on the couch rather often So when I text him that I will be at the station and need a lift at 00 24 in the night the fact that he received the message does not really help me I need to ask him to confirm he read it The proposed feature So there is a missing feature Lets add it However to preserve the privacy aware nature of Signal Private Messenger it will have to work as follows A user has to manually and deliberatly turn on the confirmations via a slider in the settings of the conversation send have read confirmations By default confirmations are off It is not nessessary for both sides to turn on the confirmations but only the side which did turn them on will send them The sender will also see a visual cue on his own messages reminding him he is sending out confirmations The other side can receive the confirmations regardless of his own setting There is no peer pressure For each conversation with a group or a person the setting has to be toggled individually There is deliberatly no global setting as we do not want new conversations to have this setting on by default

column2: Better contrast encrypted vs unencrypted messaging

column2: Ignore swipe events for ConversationListItemInboxZero
column3: Fixes 7423 Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly X I am following the Code Style Guidelines X I have tested my contribution on these devices Virtual Nexus 6 Android 6 0 Virtual Nexus 6 Android 7 0 X My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax Description This PR fixes the crash that occurs when a user swipes away the empty inbox view Before this change the onSwipe event would be interpreted as a conversation archiving The ConversationListItemInboxZero object would be cast to a ConversationListItem causing a ClassCastException which would cause Signal to crash In this change each handler for a swipe the archival action and the animation will check if the view is of type ConversationListItemInboxZero and if so will simply return This was tested on a virtual Nexus 6 on Android 6 0 and 7 0 by archiving conversations until an inbox is empty and attempting to swipe away the zero would graphic The view and archival actions then go back to normal behavior when conversations populate the inbox once more

column3: Fixes 7202 You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor License Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices HTC One M9 Android 6 0 OnePlus 5 Android TBD Virtual Nexus 5X Android 8 1 0 API 27 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax Description Describe briefly what your pull request proposes to fix Especially if you have more than one commit it is helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works In recent versions of Signal you can only share media from external apps with the 5 most recent chats in your list This can be a problem for users who are a member of many Signal groups as some groups may not be in the most recent chats Users have worked around this issue by sending a dummy message to the group with which they want to share media so that it will appear in the most recent chats and THEN sharing the media This pull request adds a More button to the bottom of the most recent chats list to improve user experience The initial list shows the 5 most recent chats Every time you press More another 5 chats are shown and so on until you reach the end of the list at which point the More button disappears

column2: Fix some potential integer overflows for expiration time
column3: Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Virtual device Pixel Android 8 0 Oreo x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the Fixes 1234 syntax Description In a number of locations in the code there were conversions of message expiration times from seconds to milliseconds and then assigned to long contexts However these conversions were being done as integer multiplication rather than long multiplication meaning that there was a potential for overflows Specifically the maximum value that could be represented before overflowing was 2 31 1000 60 60 24 days 24 8 days 1 month Luckily the current allowed timeouts are all less than that value but this fix would remove the artificial restriction effectively allowing values of 1000x greater 68 years at least for android Related 5775 Full Disclosure I initially found these problems on lgtm com which is a product that I work on There are a bunch more alerts findings that it is probably a good idea to look at

column2: Include Signal in F Droid
column3: This may be flogging a dead horse Moxie himself closed several of these issues with what i suspect was a growing sense of aggravation I once again request that Signal be added to F Droid I also feel reopening the dialogue a year later has real value Moxie is correct in stating that a download from play is easier than the harrowing process of enabling third party repos in Android This request is for more security minded users and establishes a post google path forward 127 Moxie outlined a very reasonable list of requests for F Droid and his 2013 sentiments on the security of the platform were well founded F Droid now allows to distribute a developer signed version of the app if the build is reproducable by their build server and F Droid now allows installation of apps without enabling third party support FDroid allows opt in bug reporting F Droid receives annual security audits from neutral partners and publishes the results Moxie was kind enough to provide in 2017 but as the Danger Zone implies this is textbook sub optimal distribution no better than Google Play Why we need Signal in FDroid Google has been a member of the PRISM program for 9 years The fact that it joined the program at all is more than enough reason to reassess it as the sole provider of Signal Arab Spring events have proven the big 3 google facebook twitter all go predictably dark By relying solely on Google Signal cannot be quickly deployed in such emergencies where it would do the most good

column2: Sending SMS to multiple recipients
column3: Hi obviously it is still not not possible to send SMS to multiple recipients at once Of course there have been several issues about this which are referenced in this context 232 Closed Obviously this is about MMS which is in real life not an alternative to old school SMS so it has not much to do with plain SMS 347 Closed due to cross reference not due to a solution 365 Closed because pointed to complications with the Android subsystem 413 Open but locked Here is where it gets interesting told that they wo not invest time into a legacy protocol The fact that it has been requested be many users could indicate that it is not as legacy as one might think In fact what is making an application successful is that it fulfills the users needs requests So IMHO something can not be legacy if it is used be much more than just a hand full of people Additionally says that this feature is not on the short term road map which has been three years ago long term 1395 Closed due to cross reference to 270 or 1499 1499 Closed for no real reason No offense at all I know that many developers are working in their free time I just ask because I do not understand the philosophy People ask for a feature which is crucial for some of them and get told that it is old and legacy one issue after another about this topic pops up and get closed again people get told that they are free to develop this feature which is kind of arrogant because not everyone is able to do that A question to developers may not be rejected with the message Develop it yourself From my point of view this feature is important too because I like to use Signal as my only messaging app but I can not because of this How should I argument if friends tell me I do not use Signal because it does not support this and that And from my point of view this would be a much more useful feature than 50 new emojis Greetings

column2: Reduce image stutter by using subsampling more often
column3: Fixes 7208 On some phones zooming in on large images say a 4k image would be slow and stutter a lot This is due to ZoomingImageView using a regular PhotoView instead of a SubsamplingScaleImageView ZoomingImageView decides whether or not to use a SubsamplingScaleImageView depending on whether the image has a dimension larger than BitmapUtil getMaxTextureSize However while that method will determine the maximum size of an image that is possible to render it does not necessarily mean it can be rendered efficiently There is some size at which some phones will have to continually re upload a bitmap to the GPU as seen in this systrace taken from a Moto E moto e zoom stutter We could just use SubsamplingScaleImageView all the time it has built in logic to prevent tiling on smaller images but given that it does not use Glide to load Bitmaps we should not be over using it As a result I altered BitmapUtil getMaxTextureSize to have a cap of 2048 which from research and experimentation seems to be a good number OpenGL operates in powers of 2 if 4096 is too big 2048 is the next best bet Tested on the following devices No scroll jank on images 2048x2048 No scroll jank on images 2048x2048 Moto X 2nd Generation Android 6 0 2nd gen 6649 php Moto E 2nd Generation Android 5 1 2nd gen 6986 php Galaxy S3 Mini Andoid 4 2 2 Example test image to induce jank signal 2018 03 13 104700

column2: Strip EXIF metadata from JPEG attachments
column3: This PR strips EXIF metadata from all JPEG attachments before sending Previously it was being stripped from most images by our re scaling process However smaller images would slip through and keep their metadata possibly exposing things like photo location This PR removes all EXIF metadata by re encoding the JPEG This keeps all of the visual effects of the EXIF tags like orientation by updating the image data itself while removing all EXIF tags Fixes 5968 Test Cases Sending a small JPEG that does not get resized with lots of metadata including orientation Sending a small JPEG that does not get resized with lots of metadata excluding orientation Sending a large JPEG that does get resized Sending a JPEG with no metadata Sending a GIF Sending a PNG Metadata Verification Process Used the Photo Exif Editor app to view image metadata Verified that if the image was rendering in the proper orientation in both the thumbnail and the preview Test Image cat rotated Hilariously the orientation field is not respected in my browser in the thumbnail but it is respected if you click the image and view it fullscreen Things I Still Need to Test x MMS messages x Group messages Test Devices Moto X 2nd Generation Android 6 0 2nd gen 6649 php Galaxy S3 Mini Andoid 4 2 2
